page.title: 02The River Test Lparish
page.content: The Test is a{spring-fed chalk stream, the water rising from the chalk at a constant temperature.The water is comparatively shallow and its volume rarely changes.A feature is the division of the main river into large streams.The clear,warm water encourages water plants to grow and this together with the gravel bed provide an ideal habitat for {Brown {Trout}-a native of chalk streams.Watercress growing is a small industry in Lparish. {Water-meadows} were once a feature of the Test Valley,but most of these have been drained.A meadow at 04300144 is classed as a S.S.S.I.We went pond-dipping in a stream of the Test at the end of June.We found leeches,minnows,caddis fly larva, water snails,sticklebacks and bullheads.
